intro: Acinodendron membranaceum, commonly known as the membranous acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a fleshy berry that contains several seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
